title: Salary Increase & Raise Calculator
description: Calculate the percentage increase, total annual jump, and monthly impact of a salary raise or new job offer.
methodSummary: Calculate the raw difference between new and old salaries.
Divide the difference by the original salary for the percentage jump.
Divide annual gain by 12 for monthly lifestyle impact.
assumptions: Comparison assumes both roles have similar benefits packages.
insights: A 15-20% jump is standard when switching companies.
Don't forget to account for 'bracket creep' where a raise might push you into a higher marginal tax band.

faqs.q: What is a good percentage raise?
faqs.a: Internal raises are often 3-5%, while external job hops often net 10-20% or more.
No, this is a gross increase calculator. Your net pay change will depend on your local tax laws.

faqs.q: Should I negotiate based on percentage or raw amount?
faqs.a: Both. Percentage helps you compare against market averages, while raw amount helps you plan your budget.

faqs.q: What if I get a bonus?
faqs.a: You can add the expected bonus to your 'Proposed Salary' for a total compensation comparison.
